alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 3:36PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT ...THE SOUTHWESTERN CITY OF NORFOLK...THE NORTHERN CITY OF CHESAPEAKE...THE CITY OF PORTSMOUTH AND THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF SUFFOLK THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 336 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Suffolk, or near Downtown Suffolk, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Downtown Suffolk and Suffolk around 340 PM EDT. Chesapeake around 345 PM EDT. Bowers Hill around 355 PM EDT. Portsmouth around 400 PM EDT. Western Branch around 405 PM EDT. Cradock around 410 PM EDT. Churchland around 415 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include South Norfolk, Portlock, Lummis, Suffolk Airport, Huntersville, Herberts Corner, Saunders, Magnolia, Greenbrier, and Wilroy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.
